column4: Any idea why the window border disappears when using Emerald theme?
try alt-f2 and typing emerald --replace
alt-F2 don't bring up the run window
use the terminal then
Well that's yet another issue... when I try launching a term window, it's all white... can't type it in.
That's a separate issue? Which version of ubuntu are you running?
7.10    Everything was working fine... till I added dual monitors today.  Now Emerald isn't working (no top to windows) and my term windows are all white, can't type in them.
only your terminal windows are white? That's really odd
yes.  everything else works...   might have something to do with emerald and transparent windows.
I was just about to say that. Try setting your terminal to solid color
where do I set that?
in the terminal "Edit > Current profile > effects"
and check "none (use solid color)"
lol  Umm... back to the initial problem then.... NO window borders.
The whole term window is white... can't see the edit, close, etc...
We need a working terminal or run application box to solve the original problem ;)
Try adding Option "AddARGBGLXVisuals" "True" to the device section in xorg.conf.
ok.... brb
I got my terms back.... added a few things to the xorg conf.....  still no window borders tho, tried emerald --replace.
what's the terminal output when you type emerald --replace?
nothing.... it just sits there.
hmm, I'm out of ideas. You could try reinstalling emerald altogether.
ok thanks
